headings: Develop expertise as an advanced practice registered nurse.
Admission Requirements, Degree Plan and Courses
What Can You Do With an M.S.N.-FNP Degree?
Why Earn My M.S.N.-FNP Degree at Angelo State?
paragraphs: Our online family nurse practitioner (FNP) program will prepare you to be a primary care provider to families and individuals across the lifespan.

Earning your M.S.N. degree and licensure as a family nurse practitioner will prepare you to work as an FNP in a wide variety of healthcare settings, or start your own practice. Our M.S.N. graduates have a 94% pass rate on certification exams.
Contact Information

The baccalaureate degree program in nursing, master’s degree program in nursing and the postgraduate A.P.R.N. certificate program at Angelo State University are accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (https://www.aacnnursing.org/CCNE).
In addition, all nursing programs have full approval status by the Texas Board of Nursing.
Texas Board of Nursing1801 Congress Avenue, Ste. 10-200Austin, TX 78701Telephone: 512-305-7400Fax: 512-305-7401https://www.bon.texas.gov/
Admission Requirements
Application
Degree Plan
Graduate Nursing Courses
Our dedicated and talented professors have real-world nursing experience in the subjects they teach and in virtually every healthcare setting, as well as private practice.
They are ready to take you to the next level.
Nursing Faculty and Staff
Tuition & FeesWe don’t sacrifice quality for affordability. Angelo State is committed to helping you achieve your educational goals with as little debt as possible.

ASU Distinguished Graduate ScholarshipsEarn our premier graduate scholarship based on your highest degree GPA. Once you are admitted to an ASU graduate program, you will automatically be considered. No application is necessary.
General ScholarshipsWe offer over 600 different types of scholarships. You can apply for both our general scholarships and degree-specific scholarships with one application.

Family nurse practitioners are in great demand throughout Texas and the U.S. Plus, the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics reports that employment opportunities are expected to increase by 40% through 2031, adding over 100,000 new high-paying positions.
You can begin your career as an FNP as soon as you graduate and pass the licensure exam. Our graduates currently serve in a wide variety of healthcare settings and private practice.

Over the last several years, our online M.S.N.-FNP program has earned top national rankings for quality and affordability from respected publications like Fortune Magazine, as well as multiple online higher education guides, including EduMed.org and Intelligent.com. ASU has long been recognized as one of the top nurse practitioner schools in Texas.

Our M.S.N.-FNP is an online nurse practitioner degree designed to accommodate your busy schedule. Your on-campus attendance requirements are kept to a minimum, and your clinical requirements can usually be completed in your city of residence in Texas. Our staff are here to help you set up your clinical practicums at a healthcare facility near you.

While this is an online program, you will still be invited to join our Student Nurses Association. Membership will foster additional networking opportunities with healthcare professionals, as well as a stronger connection to your fellow nursing students and the ASU Ram Family.
Contact our program advisor

Whether you’re pursuing a master’s degree, doctoral degree or certificate/certification, you have access to all the services in ourCollege of Graduate Studies and Research. You’ll find information and resources for everything from registering for classes and writing a thesis – to available graduate/teaching assistantships and graduate research opportunities.
If you want to go fast, go alone. But if you want to go far, go together.
